page_analysis.text_content:
Primary daylight plane (rear)

Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane

7.5′ max.
each
protrusion

5' min.
separation

7.5′ max.
each
protrusion

24' max. for protrusions

Note: There is no
front daylight plane.

Max building. height is:
• 30′ for structures w/roof slope < 12:12
• 33' for structures w/roof slope > 12:12
• 17' for structures on substandard or flag lots
regardless of flood plane
• variable for structures located in flood zones
except on substandard and flag lots - up to 33'

★Cumulative length of protrusions must
not exceed 15' on any one side.

Rear protrusions subject to same rules
as side protrusions

Setback line

60°

16'

Notes:
• Side daylight plane is
measured (up) at lot line.
• Rear daylight plane is
measured (up) at rear
setback.

24' max. for protrusions

Max. bldg. height

Rear yard

Rear lot line

28

visual_elements.description: A side elevation diagram of a two-story house with a gabled roof and two dormers. The diagram illustrates the 'Primary daylight plane (rear)' with various dimensions and rules for protrusions and building height. Dashed lines indicate the daylight plane and maximum building height. Solid lines indicate the building structure, ground level, and setback/lot lines. Arrows and text labels denote specific measurements and regulations.

technical_specifications.parameter: Height from ground to daylight plane intersection
Max building height (substandard/flag lots, regardless of flood plane)
Max building height (flood zones, except substandard/flag lots)
Cumulative length of protrusions (max on one side)

sections: Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane
Note: There is no front daylight plane.
★Cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15' on any one side.
Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions

additional_notes: Page number '28' is located at the bottom left corner.
The asterisk symbol (★) is used to denote a specific rule regarding cumulative length of protrusions.
The diagram includes labels for 'Setback line', 'Rear yard', and 'Rear lot line'.
cross_references: References to 'side protrusions' in the context of 'Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions'.
